DOC.brief_summary: The aim prospective , randomize study : - To assess effect clean intermittent catheterization ( CIC ) - To investigate MS patient symptom reduction ( urgency , frequency , nocturia incontinence ) use CIC combination anticholinergic drug - To identify volume Postvoid Residual ( PVR ) urine , start CIC improve bladder control QoL - To increase evidence CIC , support clinical guideline bladder management MS patient
DOC.brief_title: Efficacy Clean Intermittent Catheterization ( CIC ) Multiple Sclerosis ( MS ) Patients With Bladder Dysfunction
DOC.criteria: Provision inform consent Male female patient age 18 year MS patient already currently treat eligible treatment anticholinergic drug Patient previously confirm multiple sclerosis accord McDonald Criteria level disability le 6.5 Kutzke scale stable 6 month The patient bladder symptom ; urgency , frequency , incontinence , nocturia , PVR The patient Frequency symptom > 8 void per 24 h The patient PVR > 50 ml , measure two repetitive bladder scan measurement screen phase well randomization visit Adequate mobility lower limb , sufficient hand function ability practice CIC least three time daily Pregnancy Ongoing symptomatic Urinary Tract Infection ( UTI ) judge investigator Involvement planning conduct study ( applies Astra Tech staff staff study site ) The patient practice CIC prior study The patient undergone sphincterectomy Progressive `` Relapsing remit MS '' judge investigator Severe noncompliance protocol judge investigator and/or Astra Tech The patient participate study might impact outcome , judge investigator PVR > 250 ml , measure two repetitive bladder scan measurement screen phase well randomization visit Bladder Voiding Efficiency ( BVE ) visit 2 ( randomization ) 50 % less visit 1 ( screen )
